MS MCQs

    Create a web API with ASP.NET Core

    »

    1. Suppose you need to update a product’s name. Which HTTP action verb is the best fit for this request?

      POST

      PUT

      DELETE


    2. Suppose you have successfully created a product via the POST verb. The response contains a location header. What’s the purpose of that location header?

      To identify the location of the new resource that was created by the request.

      To provide the client with a URL for the POST action.

      To identify an existing product with the same name.


    3. In which scenario is it most appropriate to return an HTTP 404 status code, and how is it accomplished in ASP.NET Core?

      The product was successfully updated in the database. Call the BadRequest method to generate a 404.

      When model validation fails because the action’s required parameters are missing. Call the BadRequest method to generate a 404.

      When you’ve requested a product by ID and a match doesn’t exist in the underlying data store. Call the NotFound method to generate a 404.
